RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 83. Claiming Purse 13500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR ALBERTA BREDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,000. Alberta Bred Claiming Price $ 15,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FLASHIN ACES stalked the pacesetters from the four path, moved up overtaking the leader near the three-eighth marker, dueled inside of SILVERFOOT at the head of the lane, and prevailed after a long hard drive. SILVERFOOT settled outside, moved up three wide in the far turn to challenge the front, dueled outside of FLASHIN ACES under steady urging, kept on determinedly but was unable to get by. EL FANTASMA lugged out in close quarters then was tangled up entering the backstretch, settled on the rail, and faded. STORMY SUMMIT showed the way through the backstretch was overtaken and was done early.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 13000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR ALBERTA BREDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,000. Alberta Bred Claiming Price $1 5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DOC COPE sat in striking distance while five wide, advanced strongly outside into the final turn, dug in at the head of the stretch then edged away. SPOT ON DUDE was under a snug hold then moved up alongside ABOVE AND BEYOND to overtake the lead, led the way into the final turn then weakened late stretch. ABOVE AND BEYOND set the early pace, was overtaken into the far turn, rallied three to four wide entering the stretch, and missed. H K MELODY sat just off the pacesetters, swung four wide leaving the last turn, lost his path and evened out. DUKE OF DEWINTON lacked early speed, brushed the rail leaving the backstretch, and never reached contention.

ENTRY.NAME: Duke of Dewinton
ENTRY.COMMENT: lacked speed, brushed rail, no contention

ENTRY.NAME: Above and Beyond
ENTRY.OWNER: C and H Duggan Farms Ltd

ENTRY.NAME: H K Melody
ENTRY.OWNER: Stetson Inc Stetson Ryan Stetson Enterprises Ltd and Everblack Cattle Co Ltd
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, swung 4w, lost path, evened out

ENTRY.NAME: Doc Cope
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 5w, bid outside, dug in, edged away

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 10000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,000 (Lesser Claiming Races For $3,500 (AB $4,500) At Century MileN ot Considered In Eligibility). Alberta Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PERPETUAL BLISS was carried out by THIS TIME SWEETIE in the backstretch, took back off the pacesetters nearing the far turn, tipped four wide entering the lane, responded to handling then closed steadily and was along with time. STUBBORN LOVE attended the pace while four to five wide, moved up alongside THIS TIME SWEETIE then overtook the lead, and was run down late stretch. VALENTINO ROSSA raced wide through the backstretch, gained closer order into the final turn, and rallied late to get up for show. LILLY'S OF LONDON stalked from the rail, and lacked the rally needed. DRAMATIC FLAIR was gapped early, made up ground in the final turn, and offered a late mild rally. THIS TIME SWEETIE leaned on PERPETUAL BLISS early in the backstretch, contended the lead, and gave way in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Lilly's of London
ENTRY.OWNER: Schott Chris Swede Acres Ranch Siwak Daulton and Tallie Racing

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 10000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,000 (Lesser Claiming Races For $3,500 (AB $4,500) At Century Mile Not Considered In Eligibility). Alberta Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FROSTEDBIRD prompted the pace from just off the rail, drew clear entering the final turn, drifted out at the head of the stretch and held under pressure. REMARKABLE ELI sat just off the pacesetters, went in pursuit of the leader nearing the quarter pole, lost his path then angled inside, lugged in late stretch, and missed. CHESTER SLEW trailed while five wide, drove between foes at the five-sixteenth pole, was no match for the leaders in the stretch and finished evenly. BODYMOOR HEATH unhurried early, moved up closer leaving the backstretch, lacked running room near the five-sixteenth pole, and lost interest. SOMETHIN HAPPENIN offered little. CARRERA CABALLO fanned three-wide into the opening turn then set a pressured pace, was unable to move on with rival, and faded steadily. STEWARDS INQUIRY- The Stewards conducted an inquiry into the stretch run of the race but made no change.

ENTRY.NAME: Bodymoor Heath
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, lacked room, lost interest

ENTRY.NAME: Frostedbird
ENTRY.OWNER: Highfield Investment Group Inc and Frey Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted, drew clear, drifted out, held under pressure

ENTRY.NAME: Remarkable Eli
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, bid 1/4pl, lost path, lugged in, missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 44. Maiden Claiming Purse 9000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $3,500. Alberta Bred Claiming Price $4,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ARANY zipped to the front then cleared the field, saw margins diminish leaving the final turn, was under pressure through the stretch, and held on. BEAUTIFUL CALL gave chase while wide in the backstretch, loomed boldly into the stretch, kept on determinedly, and missed. LANA'S PRETTY GIRL jostled away, angled in leaving the backstretch, drove four wide then closed late for the show. VIOLET CITY reserved off the early pacesetter, lodged a rail bid but yielded late stretch. BAKED N WIRED broke inward into LANA'S PRETTY GIRL, raced wide and gave way. SUNDROP never reached contention.

ENTRY.NAME: Arany
ENTRY.OWNER: Antoine Kristina and Smith Jennifer A

ENTRY.NAME: Violet City
ENTRY.OWNER: True North Stable and Graham Thoroughbreds

ENTRY.NAME: Beautiful Call
ENTRY.OWNER: Highfield Investment Group Inc Dialed In Racing Stable Graham Thoroughbreds and

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 90. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 13500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $4,000(AB $5,000) OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023 OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING $8,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000. Alberta Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LANNY MAC vied inside for the early lead, sat just off the pace inside, moved up alongside ALL THAT GOLD into the far turn, was roused at the head of the stretch, responded gamely to the challenger, and held firm. LIFESBEENGOODSOFAR settled inside early, was asked to quicken heading into the final turn, swung four-wide then rallied determinedly outside of LANNY MAC but could not get by. UPO lagged early, gained closer order then lacked a clear path nearing the quarter pole, closed gradually inside, and got up just in time to score show. THE BEAT stalked five-wide through the backstretch, hung off the final turn, and closed gamely but was narrowly denied. LONESOME CAT fanned four wide, and rallied belatedly. ALL THAT GOLD vied outside for the early lead, set a pressured pace from the four path, was overtaken in the final turn, and gave way deep stretch. SIMMS chased outside, and tired early.

ENTRY.NAME: Lanny Mac
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied inside, roused, gamely, held firm

ENTRY.NAME: Upo
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged early, lacked clear path, closed gradually, up show

ENTRY.NAME: Lifesbeengoodsofar
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, swung 4w, rallied determinedly, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Simms
ENTRY.OWNER: Dialed In Racing Stable and Johannsen Kevin

ENTRY.NAME: All That Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Goldbeck, Ernest D. and Ilene A.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 7 1M Dirt CR: 100. Allowance Purse 23000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HYPERFOCUS sat in striking range while four wide, went in pursuit of the leader approaching the three-eighths pole, gained a slim advantage over GLAVA, battled on under right-handed encouragement, came in during the late stages taking over GLAVA'S PATH then clipped heels in the final yards before the wire. GLAVA pressed the pace while five wide, inherited the lead approaching the far turn, was joined at the quarter pole, responded to a challenge from HYPERFOCUS, rallied determinedly inside then lost his path late clipping heels with HYPERFOCUS. QUINTO SOL settled midpack, angled to the rail leaving the backstretch, moved up menacingly inside at the head of the lane but lacked the kick needed in the drive. SLAATS unhurried early, raced wide through the backstretch, drove five wide into the lane, and flattened. DECOY stalked outside early, dropped back, and offered a late mild bid. MASKWECIS tracked along the rail, lost ground in the far turn, and showed a mild interest late. GREEK GEEK trailed wide, chased through the final turn, and faded. COUNTRIFIED saved to no avail. SOLO RING set a pressured pace while two to three wide, was through early then was eased and walked off. STEWARDS INQUIRY, JOCKEY, and TRAINER OBJECTION- An objection lodged by the rider of GLAVA against the rider of HYPERFOCUS alleging interference late stretch was upheld. HYPERFOCUS was disqualified and placed second for interference to GLAVA.

ENTRY.NAME: Maskwecis
ENTRY.OWNER: Barker Jim Barker Carole and Red Ron Farms

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Hyperfocus
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4w, pursuit, gained advantage, came in, clipped heels

ENTRY.NAME: Slaats
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, raced wide, 5 wide, flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Quinto Sol
ENTRY.COMMENT: midpack, angled inside, bid inside, lacked kick

ENTRY.NAME: Glava
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 5w, led, rallied inside, clipped heels

ENTRY.NAME: Decoy
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked outside, dropped back, late mild bid
